results.title: Abraham Lincoln
results.creator_credit: Paul Nickell, Dorothy Mathews, Donald Davis and Westinghouse Studio One
results.brief_description: Television adaptation of English playwright and poet John Drinkwater’s play “Abraham Lincoln” which features a cameo role towards the end of the program by James Dean as a reluctant Union soldier sentenced to death for sleeping on guard duty. This live television drama documents a part of Lincoln’s life from his nomination for presidency through to his attendance at Ford’s Theater where his eventual assassination took place. Stars Robert Pastene as Abraham Lincoln and Judith Evelyn as Mary Lincoln. Also includes classic Westinghouse ad-breaks at intervals throughout the program. NB: Picture quality and sound is variable.

results.title: Above the timberline: the alpine tundra zone
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Tom Daly, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Remote and baffling except to the most daring climbers, the high peaks are worlds apart where only the most tenacious of living things endure. Forests give way to stunted vegetation and finally to the hardiest of plants adapted to withstand the rigours of bitter cold, glaring sun and tearing wind. The only animals found here are the wild, tough ones such as the mountain goat, elk and bighorn sheep. In true-life colour this film presents an account of life at this specialised level. Film award: Film Survey, Trieste, Italy.

results.title: Above the horizon
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exciting exploration of the weather and how man may one day learn to control it. For this film a great deal of extraordinary colour footage of the sky was put together, including a demonstration of rain-making. There are views of the geysers of the sun, of bright streamers of northern lights, of wind-stirred clouds, and even the awesome fury of a hurricane. Photography: Jean Roy Awards: Sydney, Buenos Aires, Padua, Canadian

results.title: Above the dust level [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Carla Drago, Kath Shelper, Australian Film Commission and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against a Sydney backdrop, a hypochondriac, her junkie ex-lover and a neighbour with a life threatening illness are united by dust, allergies and disappearing grey Y-fronts. Cast includes Jane Turner, Tobin Saunders and Melinda Dimitriades. (Awards: Winner of numerous awards, including Best Australian Short Comedy Award, MIFF 1999; Highly Commended, Melbourne Queer Film and Video Festival, 2000; Bronze Award, Houston Film Festival, 2000)

results.title: Above New Zealand
results.brief_description: Take a look at New Zealand as you have never seen it before. Soaring like a bird in low altitude light aircraft and helicopters, swooping down from the clouds occasionally to watch New Zealanders at work and at play. From your viewpoint in the sky you will see the natural forces that shaped New Zealand’s rugged beauty still at work reshaping the land. The history of New Zealand’s Maori and Pakeha peoples also comes vividly alive. Rated: G

results.title: Above ground iron mine
results.creator_credit: Paul Preuss and King Screen Productions
results.brief_description: An old car reaches the end of the line mechanically, and is sent to the wreckers where it is ground into small bits of iron. These are sent to a smelter where it is processed into structural elements for buildings. We then see the owner of the first car driving a new car - beginning another cycle of use of materials.

results.title: About zoos
results.creator_credit: Christine Z Wiser, N. H. Cominos, Harry Rasky and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Edited from the 1970 television special titled Zoos of the world. Explains that modern zoos around the world provide many services for animals, including places where they can graze, dig, climb, swim and sleep with protection and with nursery and medical care. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: About your body. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.
